title: Trump inspects North Carolina post hurricane, criticises FEMA
content: Former President Donald Trump criticizes FEMA workers during a visit to North Carolina amid Hurricane Helene's impact. Trump renews unfounded claims about FEMA diverting resources, while state officials and the White House stress the importance of non-partisan recovery efforts and combating misinformation.
summary: Former President Donald Trump criticizes FEMA workers during a visit to North Carolina amid Hurricane Helene's impact. Trump renews unfounded claims about FEMA diverting resources, while state officials and the White House stress the importance of non-partisan recovery efforts and combating misinformation.

title: China holds live-fire drills opposite Taiwan, week after large-scale exercise
content: China is holding live-fire drills off Fujian province near Taiwan, following a large air-and-sea drill in response to Taiwan's rejection of Beijing's sovereignty claims. The Maritime Safety Administration warned ships to avoid the area. Taiwan is monitoring these drills, which come amid heightened tensions and increased Chinese military presence around the island.
summary: China is holding live-fire drills off Fujian province near Taiwan, following a large air-and-sea drill in response to Taiwan's rejection of Beijing's sovereignty claims. The Maritime Safety Administration warned ships to avoid the area. Taiwan is monitoring these drills, which come amid heightened tensions and increased Chinese military presence around the island.

title: Hurricane Oscar wreaks havoc in Cuba, causing severe power outages
content: Cuba is grappling with its worst power outage since 2022 after Hurricane Oscar caused extensive blackouts, leaving six dead and sparking protests. Families face hardship without electricity, while the government warns against unrest. Emergency measures are in place, but many doubt a swift recovery as the economy suffers and thousands flee abroad.
summary: Cuba is grappling with its worst power outage since 2022 after Hurricane Oscar caused extensive blackouts, leaving six dead and sparking protests. Families face hardship without electricity, while the government warns against unrest. Emergency measures are in place, but many doubt a swift recovery as the economy suffers and thousands flee abroad.

title: Trump urges Christians to vote, claims Harris will restrict religious freedoms
content: Donald Trump urged Christian voters to participate in the 2024 election, positioning himself as a defender of religious freedoms and calling the election a spiritual issue. He recounted an assassination attempt that strengthened his faith and promised action against gender ideology while highlighting his decision to relocate the US embassy in Israel.
summary: Donald Trump urged Christian voters to participate in the 2024 election, positioning himself as a defender of religious freedoms and calling the election a spiritual issue. He recounted an assassination attempt that strengthened his faith and promised action against gender ideology while highlighting his decision to relocate the US embassy in Israel.

title: Russia hosts BRICS leaders, signaling Putin is far from isolated
content: President Vladimir Putin is hosting a significant BRICS summit in Russia, with world leaders attending to discuss countering Western influence. Key topics include reducing reliance on the dollar and the potential expansion of BRICS, though countries like India and the UAE express reservations. The gathering highlights a shift in global power dynamics.
summary: President Vladimir Putin is hosting a significant BRICS summit in Russia, with world leaders attending to discuss countering Western influence. Key topics include reducing reliance on the dollar and the potential expansion of BRICS, though countries like India and the UAE express reservations. The gathering highlights a shift in global power dynamics.

title: 'Did Nazi that coming': Elon Musk mocks Der Spiegel article with Hitler quip
content: Elon Musk reacted humorously on X to a German magazine likening him to Hitler. Musk's repost drew support from YouTuber Naomi Seibt, who defended him against accusations and criticized the article’s portrayal. The report also highlighted Musk’s controversial views on US elections and immigration, suggesting that these stances contribute to his image as a political antagonist.
summary: Elon Musk reacted humorously on X to a German magazine likening him to Hitler. Musk's repost drew support from YouTuber Naomi Seibt, who defended him against accusations and criticized the article’s portrayal. The report also highlighted Musk’s controversial views on US elections and immigration, suggesting that these stances contribute to his image as a political antagonist.

title: 'Israel killed my sister twice': Woman, who survived October 7 massacre, dies by suicide
content: Shirel Golan, a 22-year-old survivor of the Nova music festival massacre, took her own life on her birthday after struggling with PTSD for a year. Despite her family's efforts, they blamed the state for failing to provide proper support. Golan's brother accused the state of neglecting her mental health needs, urging immediate action to prevent more tragedies.
summary: Shirel Golan, a 22-year-old survivor of the Nova music festival massacre, took her own life on her birthday after struggling with PTSD for a year. Despite her family's efforts, they blamed the state for failing to provide proper support. Golan's brother accused the state of neglecting her mental health needs, urging immediate action to prevent more tragedies.

title: Watch: Israel finds millions in cash, gold in Hezbollah’s ‘secret’ bunker; see video
content: Israel's military has uncovered cash and gold worth hundreds of millions of dollars in a bunker beneath Beirut's Al-Sahel Hospital, allegedly built by Hezbollah's former leader. Despite these findings, Israel will not target the hospital, instead focusing on Hezbollah’s financial assets. Lebanese officials dispute these claims.
summary: Israel's military has uncovered cash and gold worth hundreds of millions of dollars in a bunker beneath Beirut's Al-Sahel Hospital, allegedly built by Hezbollah's former leader. Despite these findings, Israel will not target the hospital, instead focusing on Hezbollah’s financial assets. Lebanese officials dispute these claims.

title: Exonerated Central Park Five file defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump
content: The Exonerated Five, wrongly convicted in 1989 for a Central Park assault, filed a defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump for false statements made during a debate. Trump incorrectly claimed they killed someone and pleaded guilty. The lawsuit seeks damages for the harm caused, with their attorney stressing the pursuit of justice, not political motives.
summary: The Exonerated Five, wrongly convicted in 1989 for a Central Park assault, filed a defamation lawsuit against Donald Trump for false statements made during a debate. Trump incorrectly claimed they killed someone and pleaded guilty. The lawsuit seeks damages for the harm caused, with their attorney stressing the pursuit of justice, not political motives.

title: Will Hamas get a new chief after Yahya Sinwar's death? Here's what reports suggest
content: Following the death of Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar by Israeli forces, the group opts for a five-member ruling committee based in Doha instead of appointing a single successor. This interim committee, formed after political chief Ismail Haniyeh's assassination, will lead the movement until new internal elections scheduled for March.
summary: Following the death of Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar by Israeli forces, the group opts for a five-member ruling committee based in Doha instead of appointing a single successor. This interim committee, formed after political chief Ismail Haniyeh's assassination, will lead the movement until new internal elections scheduled for March.

title: Teen taken into custody after five family members shot dead in Washington home
content: A teenager has been detained after a tragic shooting in Fall City, Washington, left five people dead inside a home. The incident occurred around 5 am, resulting in the deaths of two adults and three teenagers. Another injured teen was taken to a Seattle hospital. Authorities have determined there is no ongoing threat to the community.
summary: A teenager has been detained after a tragic shooting in Fall City, Washington, left five people dead inside a home. The incident occurred around 5 am, resulting in the deaths of two adults and three teenagers. Another injured teen was taken to a Seattle hospital. Authorities have determined there is no ongoing threat to the community.

Israel says it 'eliminated' Hezbollah finance chief in Syria
content: The Israeli military announced it eliminated a Hezbollah commander overseeing the group’s finances in Syria and intensified strikes on Hezbollah’s financial infrastructure in Lebanon. This follows the killing of the unit’s former leader and targeted financial institutions accused of funding military activities to halt Hezbollah’s capacity and support of Hamas.
summary: The Israeli military announced it eliminated a Hezbollah commander overseeing the group’s finances in Syria and intensified strikes on Hezbollah’s financial infrastructure in Lebanon. This follows the killing of the unit’s former leader and targeted financial institutions accused of funding military activities to halt Hezbollah’s capacity and support of Hamas.
